intro: Phelipanche gussoneana var. zosimii, commonly known as the Zosimii morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other climbing vines and ornamental plants. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers typically bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
